intro: Euphrasia nemorosa subsp. curta, commonly known as the short-leaved eyebright, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a hairy texture, while its stems are upright and branched. It is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported eye-health benefits.
